info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 6 at 7:15AM CDT until April 6 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Fayette, Walker and Winston.
* WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, Winfield, Fayette, Carbon Hill, Lynn, Arley, Berry, Double Springs, Oakman, Addison, Glen Allen, Kansas, Nauvoo, Belk, Eldridge, Ashbank, Poplar Springs, Camp McDowell, Boley Springs and Bankston.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Fayette, AL; Walker, AL; Winston, AL
